Question: This person's ideal of the yeoman farmer (or a non-slave-owning planter) personified his ideal of independence.
Hints: This person was convinced Southerners had become economically dependent on slavery.
This person's remains were carried by "servants, family and friends" to the family grave site at Monticello.
This person began his childhood education under the direction of tutors at Tuckahoe along with the Randolph children.
